explanation: The program should print "Yes" when exactly two positions match between S and T, but the final conditional used 'count!=2' which prints "Yes" for all cases except when count is 2. I changed the comparison to 'count==2' so it prints "Yes" only when exactly two elements match.
fixed_code:
S=list(input().split())
T=list(input().split())
count=0
for i in range(3):
  if S[i]==T[i]:
    count+=1
print("Yes") if count==2 else print("No")
